body_html: I do not if it is correct to ask this here, but I am wondering about the installation for developers using bazel. The problem is that when I tried to compile tensorflow (tf), bazel cleans the cache so when i tried to run tensorboard (tb) it show the message that tb is not in the list. and then when I tried to compile tb it cleans tf. Is possible to keep both of them using the source code? and avoiding run bazel every single time that i need tf or tb? or Do i need to have two installations folders one for tf and another for tb?

body: I do not if it is correct to ask this here, but I am wondering about the installation for developers using bazel. The problem is that when I tried to compile tensorflow (tf), bazel cleans the cache so when i tried to run tensorboard (tb) it show the message that tb is not in the list. and then when I tried to compile tb it cleans tf. Is possible to keep both of them using the source code? and avoiding run bazel every single time that i need tf or tb?  or Do i need to have two installations folders one for tf and another for tb?
